SETTINGS.FNR.replaceKeywordsHint1: Here you can add or remove keywords that will be replaced with a replacement value. You can use multiple keywords in a single row (semicolon-separated) to replace multiple keywords with the same value, for example: '{creature};{actor.name};{name}'.
SETTINGS.FNR.replaceKeywordsHint2: If you set the document type to Actor, then you could use 'data.name' as datapath to a replacement value. In that case, instances of {creature}, {actor.name} and {name} will be replaced with the value found in 'actor.data.name'.
SETTINGS.FNR.replaceKeywordsHint3: You can use the optional static string column to always replace the keyword with the string you write there.
SETTINGS.FNR.namedCreaturesListHint: If you're not using the dnd5e system, then you can use this text field to list all the Named Creatures in your world. Use a semicolon-separated list of actor names, for example: 'King George;Goriax;The Boulder'.
SETTINGS.FNR.descriptionDataPathHint: Here you can change the datapath that specifies where the description text is stored in an item's 'item.data' object. For the dnd5e system, this would be 'data.description.value'.
SETTINGS.FNR.keywordSettingsHint: In this menu you can configure which keywords should be replaced with which values.
FNR.actorDatapathParseNotify: Feature Name Replacer | An actor datapath couldn't be parsed for {keyword}.
FNR.itemDatapathParseNotify: Feature Name Replacer | An item datapath couldn't be parsed for {keyword}.
